byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Sadi Niyungeko from Bujumbura; Isma’il Kushkush from Nairobi, Kenya; Rick Gladstone from New York; and Michael R. Gordon from Washington.
byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and PAULO NUNES DOS SANTOS

abstract: Scores of students scale American embassy walls in Bujumbura, Burundi, in effort to escape police cracking down on protest encampment; incident underscores drama playing out in country as antigovernment protests have sprung up in response to Pres Pierre Nkurunziza's announcement that he would run for third term.
lead_paragraph: Scores of students, seeking refuge from the police, entered the safety of the U.S. Embassy complex.

headline.main: Burundi Students Enter U.S. Embassy as Political Tensions Escalate
headline.print_headline: Students in Burundi Swarm U.S. Embassy

snippet: Scores of students, seeking refuge from the police, entered the safety of the U.S. Embassy complex.
